intro: Christella ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf christella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
